item.title: My Top 5 Books of 2022
item.description: Not in a particular order (or almost): Four Thousand Weeks by Oliver Burkeman You know what I told about the books not being in a particular order? Forget that for this one, as this is for sure my top 1, without any doubts. This one struck a deep chord with me and I cannot help but recommend it to every single person that I can :p From the title, you might feel like really associating it with Wait But Why’s Your Life in Weeks and from tag line, Time Management for Mortals, it’s very easy to reach the conclusion that this book is about personal productivity.
